channel.title: Teen wakes up seeing stars
channel.description:
A Belgian teenager is suing a tattooist for £10,000 after claiming she woke up with 56 stars on her face. [img]http://www.ananova.com/images/web/1510387.jpg[/img] Kimberley Vlaminck, 18, claims Rouslan Toumaniantz spoke such bad English and French that he misunderstood her at the Tattoo Boy studio in Courtrai, Belgium. She claims she fell asleep while the tattooist went to work and woke up to find 56 stars on her face. "It is horrible," sobbed Kimberley. "He has turned me into a freak. I can't go out on the street now without people looking at me." However, Mr Toumaniantz insists she "got what she wanted" - and only complained when her dad got angry and her boyfriend dumped her. Miss Vlaminch wants compensation to undergo laser treatment to remove the tattoos, but even after the treatment - that will cost upwards of 10,000 Euros, she is likely to be left with scars for life.
sauce: http://www.ananova.com/news/story/sm_3364350.html I'm just wondering how the fuck she fell asleep during tattooing...? Maybe she passed out,but no way just fell asleep.

item.title: Teen wakes up seeing stars
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

[quote=“The_Flames, post:27, topic:284048”][quote author=Speljohan link=topic=375414.msg2831686#msg2831686 date=1245408161]

[quote author=Cowie` link=topic=375414.msg2831670#msg2831670 date=1245406425]

I wonder what she claims she asked for

She claimed she wanted just 3 stars.

Instead he made her a 3 out of stars!

Lol, you’re a fkn idiot.

Anyways; she is blatantly lying… you can’t fall asleep during tatooing surely?[/quote]

Sure you can, and pretty easily too. It doesn’t hurt at all, the worst you feel is a sting and burn at the same time, and even then it feels like a tiny chinese burn.
[/quote]Doesn’t change the fact the bitch deserved it.

Nothing like a lovely, logical sentence such as that.[/quote]
It is logical as there is an implied “it” and an implied “that”.
It doesn’t change the fact that the bitch deserved it.
The sentence is grammatically acceptable - both bold words are “legally” allowed to be omitted.

Read full topic
